item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Bernard's 2 TDs lead Bengals past Steelers
item.description: Rookie Bernard leads Bengals over Steelers 20-10

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Charles: Chiefs want to win in Philly for Reid
item.description: Jamaal Charles wants to make sure that Andy Reid's return to Philadelphia is a triumphant one.

item.dc:creator: Mitch Sherman
item.title: Pelini believes Husker fans will forgive rant
item.description: Nebraska coach Bo Pelini said Tuesday he believes fans will forgive him for the 2011 comments leaked this week in which he criticized them in an expletive-laced rant.

item.dc:creator: Pat Yasinskas
item.title: Reports: Revis unhappy with Bucs' Schiano
item.description: Darrelle Revis is unhappy with coach Greg Schiano's disciplined style and his defensive scheme, according to numerous reports.

item.dc:creator: Pat Yasinskas
item.title: Top Falcons LB to IR; RB Jackson out 2-4?
item.description: The Atlanta Falcons on Tuesday placed linebacker Sean Weatherspoon on injured reserve, but designated him to return.

item.dc:creator: Ed Werder
item.title: Source: 50-50 chance Gronk back Sunday
item.description: Rob Gronkowski has been practicing for several weeks, and a source said there is a 50-50 chance that he makes his return to the lineup this week in Tampa against the Buccaneers.

item.dc:creator: Paul Kuharsky
item.title: Britt tweets he likely won't return to Titans
item.description: After irking his coaches with a costly penalty and earning some time on the bench, Tennessee Titans wide receiver Kenny Britt took to Twitter on Tuesday to indicate that he thinks this will be his last season with the team.

item.dc:creator: Todd Wills
item.title: Washington fears for job as Rangers slump
item.description: Texas Rangers manager Ron Washington said Tuesday that he fears for his job as his club trudges its way through a second straight September swoon.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Mayweather sorry for barb at De La Hoya
item.description: Floyd Mayweather Jr. issued an apology Monday for a social media post that appeared to ridicule Oscar De La Hoya for having checked into a substance abuse treatment facility.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Court denies N.J. appeal for sports betting law
item.description: A federal appeals court dealt another blow to New Jersey's efforts to legalize sports gambling Tuesday, upholding a ruling that the state's betting law conflicts with federal law and shouldn't be implemented.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Pac-12 reprimands refs from ASU-Wisconsin
item.description: The Pac-12 on Monday reprimanded officials who worked Saturday's game between Arizona State and Wisconsin for their handling of the bizarre end of the game.

item.dc:creator: Adam Schefter
item.title: Bucs' Goldson docked 1 game for helmet hit
item.description: Tampa Bay Buccaneers safety Dashon Goldson has been suspended one game for a helmet-to-helmet hit on New Orleans Saints running back Darren Sproles.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Sources: Fine, but no ban, for Meriweather
item.description: Washington Redskins safety Brandon Meriweather will be fined, but not suspended, for his helmet-to-helmet hit Sunday that knocked Green Bay Packers running back Eddie Lacy out of the game with a concussion, sources told ESPN.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Bernard's 2 TDs lead Bengals past Steelers
item.description: Rookie Bernard leads Bengals over Steelers 20-10

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Sherman takes jab at Harbaugh after win
item.description: Richard Sherman called out his former college coach after the Seattle Seahawks' 29-3 victory over the San Francisco 49ers, saying San Francisco coach Jim Harbaugh didn't acknowledge him after the game.
